title.rendered: JOB POST: Administrative Posts (Assistant, UDC, LDC) at ICMR-NIRT Chennai 2025 [16 Posts; Salary Up to Rs. 1,12,400]: Apply Date TBD

content.rendered:
Apply for Administrative Posts (Assistant, UDC, LDC) at ICMR-NIRT Chennai 2025. It has 16 vacancies with salaries up to Rs. 1,12,400. Application dates TBD. Stay updated!

About the Opportunity

The Indian Council of Medical Research – National Institute for Research in Tuberculosis (ICMR-NIRT), Chennai, under the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, Government of India, is hiring for various administrative posts. This is a great opportunity for eligible Indian citizens to apply for permanent government jobs. Applications will only be accepted online through the official ICMR-NIRT websites (links to be provided soon). Read this carefully to understand the posts, eligibility, and how to apply!

Important Dates

  • Online Application Start Date: To be announced soon.
  • Last Date to Apply Online: To be announced soon.
  • Admit Card Download: Available after the application closing date (exact date to be shared later).
  • Computer-Based Test (CBT) & Skill Test: Dates will be shared later.

Note: Keep checking the ICMR/NIRT websites for updates.

Available Posts and Details

1. Assistant

  • Post Code: ASST01
  • Group: Group-B
  • Salary: Pay Level 6 of 7th CPC (Rs. 35,400 – Rs. 1,12,400)
  • Age Limit: Up to 30 years
  • Vacancies: 5 posts
    • Unreserved (UR): 4
    • Other Backward Classes (OBC): 1
  • Qualifications:
    • A 3-year Bachelor’s degree in any subject from a recognized university/institution.
    • Working knowledge of computers (MS Office, PowerPoint).

2. Upper Division Clerk (UDC)

  • Post Code: UDC02
  • Group: Group-C
  • Salary: Pay Level 4 of 7th CPC (Rs. 25,500 – Rs. 81,100)
  • Age Limit: 18 to 27 years
  • Vacancies: 1 post
    • Unreserved (UR): 1
  • Qualifications:
    • A degree from a recognized university (or equivalent).
    • Typing speed:
      • 35 words per minute (w.p.m.) in English, OR
      • 30 w.p.m. in Hindi on a computer.
      • (This equals 10,500 key depressions per hour (KDPH) in English or 9,000 KDPH in Hindi, averaging 5 key depressions per word.)

3. Lower Division Clerk (LDC)

  • Post Code: LDC03
  • Group: Group-C
  • Salary: Pay Level 2 of 7th CPC (Rs. 19,900 – Rs. 63,200)
  • Age Limit: 18 to 27 years
  • Vacancies: 10 posts
    • Unreserved (UR): 6
    • Other Backward Classes (OBC): 2
    • Scheduled Caste (SC): 1
    • Economically Weaker Section (EWS): 1
  • Qualifications:
    • 12th class pass (or equivalent) from a recognized board/university.
    • Typing speed:
      • 35 w.p.m. in English, OR
      • 30 w.p.m. in Hindi on a computer.
      • (This equals 10,500 KDPH in English or 9,000 KDPH in Hindi, averaging 5 key depressions per word.)

Note: The number of vacancies may change (increase or decrease) at any stage of recruitment.

How to Apply?

  • Apply Online Only: Use the link on ICMR/NIRT websites (ICMR or NIRT) when it becomes available.
  • Requirements:
    • A valid email ID and mobile number (needed for registration and updates).
    • Pay the application fee online (non-refundable):
      • Assistant: Rs. 2,000 (UR/OBC/EWS), Rs. 1,600 (SC/Women).
      • UDC & LDC: Rs. 1,600 (UR/OBC/EWS), Rs. 1,600 (SC/Women).
    • Separate applications and fees are required for each post if applying for more than one.
  • Documents to Upload:
    • Proof of Date of Birth (e.g., 10th certificate).
    • Category proof (SC/OBC/EWS certificate, if applicable).
    • Educational certificates (from 10th class onwards).
    • Work experience proof (if any, with start/end dates).
    • No Objection Certificate (NOC) for government employees.
    • Other relevant documents.

Important:

  • All communication (e.g., admit cards, exam dates) will be sent via email or posted on the ICMR/NIRT websites.
  • Check your email and the website regularly. ICMR-NIRT is not responsible for missed updates due to wrong email IDs or delays.

Selection Process

For Assistant

  • Tier 1: Computer-Based Test (CBT)
    • 100 multiple-choice questions (MCQs).
    • Topics: English Language, General Knowledge, Reasoning, Computer Aptitude, Quantitative Aptitude (20 questions each).
    • Total Marks: 100 (1 mark per correct answer, -0.25 for wrong answers).
    • Time: 90 minutes.
    • Minimum Passing Marks: 50% (UR/OBC).
  • Tier 2: Computer Proficiency Test (CPT)
    • Tasks: Typing, Excel sheet preparation, PowerPoint slides.
    • Typing speed: 45 w.p.m. (English) or 40 w.p.m. (Hindi).
    • Total Marks: 20 (qualifying only, need 50% i.e., 10 marks).
    • Time: 60 minutes.
  • Experience Bonus: Up to 5 extra marks for relevant work experience:
    • 1-2 years: 1 mark
    • 2-4 years: 2 marks
    • 4-6 years: 3 marks
    • 6-8 years: 4 marks
    • 8+ years: 5 marks
  • Final Merit: CBT score (95%) + Experience (5%) = 100%. Top candidates (1:10 ratio) move to CPT, and final selection is based on this score if CPT is cleared.

For Upper Division Clerk (UDC) & Lower Division Clerk (LDC)

  • Tier 1: Computer-Based Test (CBT)
    • Same as Assistant (100 MCQs, 100 marks, 90 minutes, negative marking).
    • Minimum Passing Marks:
      • UR/EWS/OBC: 50%
      • SC: 40%
  • Tier 2: Computer Skill Test (Typing)
    • Qualifying only: 35 w.p.m. (English) or 30 w.p.m. (Hindi).
  • Experience Bonus: Same as Assistant (up to 5 marks).
  • Final Merit: CBT score (95%) + Experience (5%) = 100%. Top candidates (1:10 ratio) move to the typing test, and final selection is based on this score if the typing test is cleared.

Exam Syllabus (Same for All Posts)

  • English Language: Comprehension, grammar, vocabulary, idioms.
  • General Knowledge: Indian history, geography, economy, polity, science, awards, sports, current affairs.
  • Reasoning: Analogies, series, coding-decoding, relationships.
  • Computer Aptitude: Basics of computers, MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), IT concepts.
  • Quantitative Aptitude: Math topics like percentages, ratios, time/work, algebra, data interpretation.
    Note: Difficulty level matches the required qualification (degree for Assistant/UDC, 12th for LDC).

Exam Centers

  • CBT and Skill Test centers will be announced later on the ICMR/NIRT websites.

Eligibility

  • Nationality: Must be an Indian citizen.
  • Age Limit:
    • Calculated as of the last date for applications.
    • Based on 10th certificate only.
    • Relaxation:
      • SC: +5 years
      • OBC: +3 years
      • Central Govt. Employees (3+ years of service): +5 years (UR), +8 years (OBC), +10 years (SC).

Other Important Information

  • Probation: 2 years for all posts.
  • Application Fee: Non-refundable, paid online. No exemptions for ICMR employees.
  • Documents: Ensure certificates are valid (e.g., OBC certificate must be from 2024-25 and exclude creamy layer; EWS certificate for 2024-25).
  • Posting: All India transfer possible (any ICMR center/unit).
  • Rules:
    • No TA/DA for exams.
    • False information or ineligibility will lead to cancellation at any stage.
    • Director, ICMR-NIRT can change vacancy numbers or cancel the process without reason.

Tips for Job Seekers

  • Check your eligibility (age, education, typing speed) before applying.
  • Prepare for the CBT (practice English, math, reasoning, and computer skills).
  • Keep all documents ready in scanned format.
  • Stay updated via the ICMR/NIRT websites for the application link and dates.

How to Apply?

Use the link on ICMR/NIRT websites (ICMR or NIRT) when it becomes available.

Deadline

TBA

Click here to view the official notification of JOB POST: Administrative Posts (Assistant, UDC, LDC) at ICMR-NIRT Chennai 2025.
